result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joni J. Shelton

records.addlTxt:
No illegal use or possession of controlled substances without prescription. 
No contact with victim or residence.

3:29 PM Court calls 22CM14, 20CM54, 20CM123. Defendant Joni J. Shelton in court.  Attorney Bradley J Jansen in court via zoom for Joni J. Shelton.  Attorney Kelly L Hays in court for State of Wisconsin. State reviews case history. 22CM14 $1,000.00. Def. owes $2,000.00 total bond on all cases. Atty. Jansen makes statement and requests warrant to be quashed. State does not object. Court quashes warrant. Atty. Jansen waives reading and enters pleas of Not Guilty. Court receives Not Guilty pleas in 22CM14. State heard on victim rights and asks for $1,000.00 to be applied to 22CM54 and 20CM123, also asks for one bond for $1,500.00 with conditions, No illegal use or possession of controlled substances and no contact with victim in 22CM54. Atty Jansen requests $1,000.00 cash bond. Court has reviewed criminal complaint and orders $1,000.00 cash bond on all 3 files with conditions, No illegal use or possession of controlled substances without prescription and no contact with victim or residence.
Status conference scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Letter to Clerk of Court's and Court requesting a ROW hearing and to update defendant's address
Routed to JA
